health_factors.name: STAGE I
health_factors.print_name: Pressure Injury Stage 1 (Intact Skin; Nonblanchable Redness)
health_factors.description: Intact skin with nonblanchable redness of a localized area, usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have visible blanching; its color may differ from the surrounding area.

health_factors.name: STAGE I #2
health_factors.print_name: Pressure Injury Stage1(Intact Skin; Nonblanchable Redness)#2
health_factors.description: Intact skin with nonblanchable redness of a localized area, usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have visible blanching; its color may differ from the surrounding area, second.

health_factors.name: STAGE I #3
health_factors.print_name: Pressure Injury Stage1(Intact Skin; Nonblanchable Redness)#3
health_factors.description: Intact skin with nonblanchable redness of a localized area, usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have visible blanching; its color may differ from the surrounding area, third.

health_factors.name: STAGE I #4
health_factors.print_name: Pressure Injury Stage1(Intact Skin; Nonblanchable Redness)#4
health_factors.description: Intact skin with nonblanchable redness of a localized area, usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have visible blanching; its color may differ from the surrounding area, fourth.

health_factors.name: STAGE I #5
health_factors.print_name: Pressure Injury Stage1(Intact Skin; Nonblanchable Redness)#5
health_factors.description: Intact skin with nonblanchable redness of a localized area, usually over a bony prominence. Darkly pigmented skin may not have visible blanching; its color may differ from the surrounding area, fifth.

health_factors.name: STAGE II
health_factors.description: Partial thickness loss of dermis presenting as a shallow open ulcer with a red-pink wound bed, without slough. It may also present as an intact or open/ruptured serum-filled blister.

health_factors.name: STAGE II #2
health_factors.description: Partial thickness loss of dermis presenting as a shallow open ulcer with a red-pink wound bed, without slough. It may also present as an intact or open/ruptured serum-filled blister, second.

health_factors.name: STAGE II #3
health_factors.description: Partial thickness loss of dermis presenting as a shallow open ulcer with a red-pink wound bed, without slough. It may also present as an intact or open/ruptured serum-filled blister, third.

health_factors.name: STAGE II #4
health_factors.description: Partial thickness loss of dermis presenting as a shallow open ulcer with a red-pink wound bed, without slough. It may also present as an intact or open/ruptured serum-filled blister.-fourth

health_factors.name: STAGE II #5
health_factors.description: Partial thickness loss of dermis presenting as a shallow open ulcer with a red-pink wound bed, without slough. It may also present as an intact or open/ruptured serum-filled blister, fifth.

health_factors.name: STAGE III
health_factors.description: Subcutaneous tissue visible within pressure injury.

health_factors.name: SUSPECTED DEEP TISSUE INJURY
health_factors.print_name: Pressure Injury With Suspected Deep Tissue Injury
health_factors.description: Intact or non-intact skin with localized area of persistent non-blanchable deep red, maroon, purple discoloration or epidermal separation revealing a dark wound bed or blood filled blister.

health_factors.name: SUSPECTED DEEP TISSUE INJURY #2
health_factors.print_name: Pressure Injury With Suspected Deep Tissue Injury#2
health_factors.description: Intact or non-intact skin with localized area of persistent non-blanchable deep red, maroon, purple discoloration or epidermal separation revealing a dark wound bed or blood filled blister, second.

health_factors.name: SUSPECTED DEEP TISSUE INJURY #3

health_factors.description: Intact or non-intact skin with localized area of persistent non-blanchable deep red, maroon, purple discoloration or epidermal separation revealing a dark wound bed or blood filled blister, third.

health_factors.name: SUSPECTED DEEP TISSUE INJURY #4

health_factors.description: Intact or non-intact skin with localized area of persistent non-blanchable deep red, maroon, purple discoloration or epidermal separation revealing a dark wound bed or blood filled blister, fourth.

health_factors.name: SUSPECTED DEEP TISSUE INJURY #5
health_factors.print_name: Pressure Injury With Suspected Deep Tissue Injury#5
health_factors.description: Intact or non-intact skin with localized area of persistent non-blanchable deep red, maroon, purple discoloration or epidermal separation revealing a dark wound bed or blood filled blister, fifth.

health_factors.name: UNABLE TO STAGE (PU)
health_factors.description: Full thickness skin or tissue loss – depth unknown. Full thickness tissue loss in which actual depth of the ulcer is completely obscured by slough (yellow, tan, gray, green or brown) and/or eschar (tan, brown or black) in the wound bed.

health_factors.name: UNABLE TO STAGE (PU) #2
health_factors.description: Full thickness skin or tissue loss – depth unknown. Full thickness tissue loss in which actual depth of the ulcer is completely obscured by slough (yellow, tan, gray, green or brown) and/or eschar (tan, brown or black) in the wound bed, second.

health_factors.name: UNABLE TO STAGE (PU) #3
health_factors.description: Full thickness skin or tissue loss – depth unknown. Full thickness tissue loss in which actual depth of the ulcer is completely obscured by slough (yellow, tan, gray, green or brown) and/or eschar (tan, brown or black) in the wound bed, third.

health_factors.name: UNABLE TO STAGE (PU) #4
health_factors.description: Full thickness skin or tissue loss – depth unknown. Full thickness tissue loss in which actual depth of the ulcer is completely obscured by slough (yellow, tan, gray, green or brown) and/or eschar (tan, brown or black) in the wound bed, fourth.

health_factors.name: UNABLE TO STAGE (PU) #5
health_factors.description: Full thickness skin or tissue loss – depth unknown. Full thickness tissue loss in which actual depth of the ulcer is completely obscured by slough (yellow, tan, gray, green or brown) and/or eschar (tan, brown or black) in the wound bed, fifth.
